{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox film | name = Battleship | image = Battleship Poster.jpg | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Peter Berg]] | producer = {{plainlist| * Peter Berg * [[Brian Goldner]] * [[Scott Stuber]] * Sarah Aubrey * Duncan Henderson * Bennett Schneir }} | writer = {{unbulleted list| Jon Hoeber | Erich Hoeber }} | based on = {{based on|''[[Battleship (game)|Battleship]]''|[[Hasbro]]}} | starring = {{plainlist| * [[Taylor Kitsch]] * [[Alexander Skarsgård]] * [[Rihanna]] * [[Brooklyn Decker]] * [[Tadanobu Asano]] * [[Liam Neeson]] }} | music = [[Steve Jablonsky]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2011/05/31/steve-jablonsky-confirmed-to-score-battleship/| title=Steve Jablonsky Confirmed to Score ‘Battleship' |publisher=''Film Music Reporter'' |date=May 31, 2011 |accessdate=June 6, 2011}}</ref> | cinematography = [[Tobias A. Schliessler]] | editing = {{plainlist| * Colby Parker Jr. * Billy Rich * [[Paul Rubell]] }} | studio = {{ubl|[[Hasbro Studios]]|Bluegrass Films|Film 44}} | distributor = [[Universal Pictures]] | released = {{Film date|2012|04|03|[[Tokyo]]|2012|05|18|United States}} | runtime = 131 minutes<ref name="boxofficemojo1">{{cite journal|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=battleship.htm |title=Box Office Mojo (2012-03-13). "‘Box Office Mojo Movie Gross"|accessdate=August 6, 2012}}</ref> | country = United States | language = English | budget = $209–220 million<ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.forbes.com/sites/johngaudiosi/2012/05/20/220-million-battleship-flop-sinks-not-only-universal-pictures-but-activision-game/ | title = $220 Million Battleship Flop Sinks Not Only Universal Pictures, But Activision Game | author = John Gaudiosi | publisher = ''[[Forbes]]'' | date = May 30, 2012 | accessdate = December 27, 2014 | quote = Universal Pictures reported a $209 million production cost (unadjusted) excluding advertising budget.}}</ref><ref name="boxofficemojo1"/> | gross = $303 million<ref name="boxofficemojo1"/> }} '''''Battleship''''' is a 2012 American [[military science fiction]] [[action film]] loosely based on the [[board game]] [[Battleship (game)|of the same name]]. The film was directed by [[Peter Berg]] and starred [[Taylor Kitsch]], [[Brooklyn Decker]], [[Rihanna]], [[Tadanobu Asano]], [[Alexander Skarsgård]], and [[Liam Neeson]]. Filming took place in [[Hawaii]] and on {{USS|Missouri|BB-63|6}}. In the film, a fleet of ships are forced to do battle with an armada of [[Extraterrestrial life|extraterrestrial]] origin in order to thwart their destructive goals.
''Battleship'' premiered in Tokyo on April 3, 2012 and received a wide release by [[Universal Pictures]] on May 18. It received mixed to negative reviews and underperformed at the box office, making only $65 million in North America against its total gross of $303 million worldwide.
==Plot==
In 2005, the distant [[Gliese 581|Gliese planetary system]] is discovered to have a potentially [[Habitable zone|habitable planet]] and a communications array is built by [[NASA]] in [[Hawaii]] to send a transmission to contact any [[Extraterrestrial life|intelligent life]]. Meanwhile, Alex Hopper is arrested while attempting to impress Sam Shane. His brother, naval officer Stone, forces Alex to join the [[U.S. Navy]] in order to improve his life.
In 2012, Alex and Sam are in a relationship; Alex serves as a Tactical Actions Officer as a [[Lieutenant (navy)|lieutenant]] aboard {{USS|John Paul Jones|DDG-53|6}} while Stone is the commander aboard {{USS|Sampson|DDG-102|6}}, but Alex is in danger of receiving a disciplinary [[military discharge|discharge]]. During the [[Exercise RIMPAC#RIMPAC 2012|2012 RIMPAC exercise]], five alien spacecraft arrive. Their communications ship collides with a satellite and crashes in [[Hong Kong]] while the other four land in the waters off Hawaii. ''Sampson'', ''John Paul Jones'', and their Japanese sister ship [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force|JDS]] {{ship|JDS|Myōkō||2}} are ordered by Admiral Terrance Shane to investigate, and they discover a floating structure. When it is touched by Alex it generates a [[force shield|force field]] that encloses the Hawaiian Islands and separates the three ships from the fleet. Three alien warships surface and commence to engage both the ''Sampson'' and ''Myōkō'' which are destroyed, resulting in Stone's death, while the command crew of ''John Paul Jones'' are killed. With Alex assuming command as the ranking officer, they recover the survivors from ''Myōkō'' including its commanding officer, Captain Yugi Nagata. The aliens also launch drones to attack Hawaii which cause heavy damage.
On Oahu, Sam is accompanying retired [[U.S. Army]] Colonel and double amputee Mick Canales on a mountain hike. After becoming aware of the aliens' presence, they encounter scientist Cal Zapata who informs them the aliens have taken over the communications array, and Mick determines that they are planning to use it to re-establish military communications with their home planet. Aboard ''John Paul Jones'', naval personnel capture a semi-conscious alien. The alien forms a telepathic link with Alex, showing him their history of destroying worlds. Other aliens arrive and retrieve their comrade, but are prevented from sabotaging the ship. Examination of the captured alien's helmet reveals the aliens are sensitive to sunlight. Ashore, Sam, Nick and Zapata recover his [[spectrum analyzer]] from the aliens and they use it to radio ''John Paul Jones'' to inform them the aliens intend military telecommunication with their home planet in four hours.
Captain Nagata suggests to use [[National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration]]'s [[tsunami warning system|tsunami warning buoys]] around Hawaii to track the alien warships. This allows ''John Paul Jones'' to destroy two of them. At dawn, they lure the remaining warship eastwards as Alex and Nagata shoot out its bridge windows, blinding its crew and allowing ''John Paul Jones'' to destroy it, but ''John Paul Jones'' is subsequently sunk by alien drones.
The survivors return to Pearl Harbor and commandeer the previously decommissioned World War II [[battleship]] {{USS|Missouri|BB-63|6}} with the aid of the retired veterans preserving her, restoring her to battle readiness and confronting the floating structure, revealed to be a giant mothership. ''Missouri'' is able to severely damage the mothership and disable the force field, while Admiral Shane scrambles a flight of [[Royal Australian Air Force]] [[Boeing F/A-18E/F Super Hornet|Boeing F/A-18]] fighter jets from aircraft carrier {{USS|Ronald Reagan|CVN-76|6}}. Meanwhile, Sam, Mick and Cal attempt to stall the aliens at the communications array. As the mothership rallies against ''Missouri'', Alex uses their last shell to destroy the communications array. All hope is lost for ''Missouri'' and those onboard until the Australian fighter jets arrive in time and destroy the mothership, saving ''Missouri'' and eliminating the alien threat.
A ceremony is held to honor the military personnel, where Alex is promoted to [[Lieutenant commander (United States)|lieutenant commander]] and presented with both a [[Silver Star]] and his brother's posthumous [[Navy Cross (United States)|Navy Cross]]. After the ceremony, Alex asks Sam's father Admiral Shane for her hand in marriage. The admiral initially refuses, but then invites Alex to lunch to discuss the matter.
In a [[post-credits scene]], three teenagers and a [[handyman]] in Scotland discover a crashed alien pod. When they open it, an alien hand reaches out, and they run off in terror.
==Cast== * [[Taylor Kitsch]] as Lieutenant Alex Hopper, an undisciplined U.S. Navy Weapons Officer assigned to {{USS|John Paul Jones|DDG-53|6}}. * [[Liam Neeson]] as Admiral Terrance Shane, Commander of the U.S. Pacific Fleet and father of Samantha Shane. * [[Alexander Skarsgård]] as Commander Stone Hopper, Alex's older brother, Commanding Officer of {{USS|Sampson|DDG-102|6}}. * [[Rihanna]] as Petty Officer Cora Raikes, crew mate and a weapons specialist on {{USS|John Paul Jones|DDG-53|6}}. * [[Brooklyn Decker]] as Samantha Shane, a physical therapist and Alex Hopper's girlfriend. * [[Tadanobu Asano]] as Captain Yugi Nagata, JMSDF, Commanding Officer of {{Ship|JDS|Myōkō|DDG-175|6}}. * [[Hamish Linklater]] as Cal Zapata, a scientist working on O'ahu * [[Jesse Plemons]] as Jimmy "Ordy" Ord, undesignated Seaman on {{USS|John Paul Jones|DDG-53|6}} * [[John Tui]] as Chief Petty Officer Walter "Beast" Lynch, a crew mate of {{USS|John Paul Jones|DDG-53|6}} * [[Gregory D. Gadson]] as Lieutenant Colonel Mick Canales, a U.S. Army combat veteran and double amputee. * [[Adam Godley]] as Dr. Nogrady, the scientist leading the Beacon program. * [[Peter MacNicol]] as the U.S. Secretary of Defense.
==Production== [[File:Alexander Skarsgard, Brooklyn Decker & Peter Berg by Gage Skidmore.jpg|left|thumb|Alexander Skarsgard, Brooklyn Decker and Peter Berg promoting the film at [[WonderCon]] 2012.]] ''Battleship'' was to begin filming in [[Australia]]'s [[Gold Coast, Queensland|Gold Coast]] in 2010, but the production company changed location due to a lack of Australian government tax incentives and a high estimated budget of $209 million.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goldcoast.com.au/article/2010/03/27/202331_gold-coast-news.html |title=$100m Film Deal Sunk |publisher=goldcoast.com.au |date=March 27, 2010 |accessdate=July 10, 2010}}</ref>
Filming took place in the [[United States]] on the [[Hawaii]]an islands of [[Maui]] and [[Oahu]], as well as in [[Sherman Oaks, California]] to do a few apartment scenes and in [[Playa del Rey, California]] where they filmed a driving scene along with a shootout.<ref>{{cite news |first=Jeremy |last=Holcombe |url=http://www.alohaupdate.com/2010/09/08/first-pictures-of-rihanna-and-taylor-kitsch-on-hawaii-battleship-set |title=First Pictures of Rihanna and Taylor Kitsch on Hawaii Battleship Set|work=Aloha Update |date=September 8, 2010 |accessdate=September 13, 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100912143436/http://www.alohaupdate.com/2010/09/08/first-pictures-of-rihanna-and-taylor-kitsch-on-hawaii-battleship-set| archivedate= September 12, 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> Further filming was done on {{USS|Missouri|BB-63|6}}.<ref>http://www.hawaiimagazine.com/blogs/hawaii_today/2012/5/21/Hawaii_Oahu_Pearl_Harbor_battleship_film</ref> Some scenes were also filmed in [[Baton Rouge, Louisiana|Baton Rouge]], [[Louisiana]].<ref>{{cite journal |url=https://www.scribd.com/doc/33744919/Production-Weekly-%E2%80%93-Issue-715-%E2%80%93-Thursday-June-3-2010-125-listings-%E2%80%93-26-pages |title=Production Weekly – Issue 715 – Thursday, June 3, 2010 / 125 listings – 26 pages |journal=Production Weekly |issue=715 |page=3 |publisher=Scribd.com |date=June 3, 2010 |accessdate=July 27, 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100714182438/http://www.scribd.com/doc/33744919/Production-Weekly-%E2%80%93-Issue-715-%E2%80%93-Thursday-June-3-2010-125-listings-%E2%80%93-26-pages |archivedate=July 14, 2010 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
The [[Science & Entertainment Exchange]] provided science consultation for the film.<ref>{{cite web|title=Recent Projects|url=http://www.scienceandentertainmentexchange.org/projects|publisher=National Academy of Sciences|accessdate=July 7, 2011| archiveurl= https://archive.is/20110726111433/http://www.scienceandentertainmentexchange.org/projects| archivedate= July 26, 2011 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref>
A {{sclass-|Kongō|destroyer|1}} of the [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]] also appeared in the film.<ref>{{cite web |title=MSDF in New Hollywood Film, "BATTLESHIP" |url=http://newpacificinstitute.org/jsw/?p=7492 |author=Kyle Mizokami |date=July 27, 2011 |work=New Pacific Institute Project}}</ref>
===Casting=== [[Jeremy Renner]] was originally considered for the role of Hopper, but the actor chose to star in a [[Paul Thomas Anderson]] drama filming at roughly the same time.<ref>{{cite web|last=Rosenberg|first=Adam|title='The Hurt Locker' Star Jeremy Renner In Talks For 'Battleship,' Edgar Allen[sic] Poe's Last Days Thriller|url=http://moviesblog.mtv.com/2010/02/18/the-hurt-locker-star-jeremy-renner-in-talks-for-battleship-edgar-allen-poes-last-days-thriller/|publisher=MTV|accessdate=April 24, 2012|date=February 18, 2012}}</ref><ref name="THR">{{cite web|url=http://heatvision.hollywoodreporter.com/2010/04/taylor-kitsch-to-star-in-battleship-film.html |title=Taylor Kitsch to Star in 'Battleship' Film (Exclusive) |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=April 4, 2010 |accessdate=July 27, 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100801013227/http://heatvision.hollywoodreporter.com/2010/04/taylor-kitsch-to-star-in-battleship-film.html |archivedate=August 1, 2010 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy }}</ref> In April 2010, it was reported that Taylor Kitsch had been cast as Alex Hopper,<ref name="THR"/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.totalfilm.com/news/taylor-kitsch-boards-battleship-movie |title=Taylor Kitsch boards Battleship movie |first=Josh |last=Winning |work=[[Total Film]] |date=April 8, 2010 |accessdate=March 20, 2011}}</ref> Alexander Skarsgård played his brother Stone Hopper, Brooklyn Decker stars as Sam, Hopper's fiancee and Liam Neeson as Admiral Shane, Sam's father and Hopper's superior officer.<ref name="comingsoon">{{cite web |url=http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=69603 |title=Liam Neeson Joins Battleship Cast |work=[[ComingSoon.net]] |date=September 7, 2010 |accessdate=September 7, 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100909001252/http://www.comingsoon.net/news/movienews.php?id=69603| archivedate= September 9, 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Benigno |first=Anthony |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/movies/2010/07/27/2010-07-27_rihanna_to_make_movie_debut_in_battleship_opposite_aleksander_skarsgard_taylor_k.html |title=Rihanna to make movie debut in 'Battleship' opposite Alexander Skarsgard, Taylor Kitsch |work=''[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]'' |date=July 27, 2010 |accessdate=March 20, 2011}}</ref> Barbadian R&B singer Rihanna makes her acting debut in the film, as a sailor.<ref>{{cite web |last=McNary |first=Dave |url=http://www.variety.com/article/VR1118022212.html?categoryId=13&cs=1 |title=Rihanna to star in Universal's ''Battleship'' |work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |date=July 26, 2010 |accessdate=March 20, 2011}}</ref> In an interview with ''[[GQ]]'', Berg explained how he came up with the idea to cast her. He realized she could act after her appearance on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Berg|first=Peter|title=Why I cast Rihanna in Battleship|url=http://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/entertainment/articles/2012-04/04/rihanna-battleship-movie-trailer-cast-peter-berg|work=[[GQ]]|accessdate=April 24, 2012|date=April 4, 2012}}</ref> She accepted the role because she wanted "to do something badass" and also because it wasn't a role too big for her to play.<ref>{{cite web|last=Prinzivalli|first=Fallon|title=Rihanna Wanted To Be 'Badass,' Not A Love Interest In 'Battleship'|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1682370/rihanna-battleship-badass.jhtml|publisher=MTV|accessdate=April 24, 2012|date=April 3, 2012}}</ref> [[Tadanobu Asano]] also has a role in the film as the commander of a Japanese ''Kongō''-class destroyer. Double amputee U.S. Army [[Colonel]] [[Gregory D. Gadson|Gregory Gadson]], who had never acted before, plays [[Lieutenant colonel|LTC]] Mick Canales.<ref>{{cite news|url =http://www.philstar.com/funfare/article.aspx?articleid=796786&publicationsubcategoryid=70|title =Legless colonel plays self in Battleship|date =April 14, 2012|accessdate =April 19, 2012|publisher =Phil Star}}</ref> He was cast after Berg saw a picture of him in the ''[[National Geographic (magazine)|National Geographic Magazine]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Pete Berg Interview|url=http://www.viewlondon.co.uk/cinemas/pete-berg-interview-feature-interview-4427-1.html|work=[[View London]]|accessdate=May 12, 2012|page=2}}</ref>
The film marks the reunion between former co-stars Kitsch and Jesse Plemons, who previously worked together on Berg's TV series ''[[Friday Night Lights (TV series)|Friday Night Lights]]''. Berg said he loves working with friends and explained he knew how comfortable Kitsch was with Plemons, "I know that he’s really good for Taylor and he makes Taylor better. So, I wrote that whole part for Jesse." He added, "I never thought of it as a ''Friday Night Lights'' reunion. I thought of it as protection, bringing a trusted family member in."<ref>{{cite web|last=Radish|first=Christina|title=Brooklyn Decker and Director Peter Berg Talk BATTLESHIP, Naval Warfare and the Design of the Aliens at WonderCon|url=http://collider.com/brooklyn-decker-peter-berg-battleship-interview/153633/|publisher=Collider.com|accessdate=April 15, 2012|date=March 19, 2012}}</ref>
U.S. Navy sailors were used as extras in various parts of this film. Sailors from assorted commands in Navy Region Hawaii assisted with line handling to take {{USS|Missouri|BB-63|2}} in and out of port for a day of shooting in mid 2010. A few months later, the production team put out a casting call for sailors stationed at various sea commands at Naval Station Mayport, Florida to serve as extras.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.staradvertiser.com/features/20111113__Whatever_the_plot_Missouri_has_big_role_in_Battleship.html?id=133763778|title=Whatever the plot, Missouri has big role in 'Battleship'|first=Mike|last=Gordon|publisher=[[Honolulu Star-Advertiser]]|date=November 11, 2011|accessdate=May 16, 2012}}</ref> Sailors were also taken from various ships stationed at [[Naval Station Mayport]], Jacksonville, Florida: {{USS|Hué City|CG-66|6}}, {{USS|Carney|DDG-64|6}} and USS {{USS|Vicksburg|CG-69|2}} were some of the ships that provided sailors.<ref>{{cite web|last=Klimas |first=Jacqueline |url=http://www.navytimes.com/news/2012/05/navy-battleship-movie-sailors-versus-aliens-051412/ |title=Sailors vs. aliens: ‘Battleship’ debuts Friday |work=Navy Times |date=May 15, 2012 |accessdate=May 26, 2012}}</ref>
==Music== {{Anchor|Soundtrack|Score}} {{Infobox album | name = Battleship | type = Soundtrack | artist = [[Steve Jablonsky]] | cover = | alt = | released = May 8, 2012 | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Film score]] | length = 77:28 | label = [[Varèse Sarabande]] | producer = Steve Jablonsky | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }} Due to his success with the ''[[Transformers (film series)|Transformers]]'' franchise, composer [[Steve Jablonsky]] was chosen to score the official soundtrack. The soundtrack features original compositions from Jablonsky and features rock guitarist [[Tom Morello]] from [[Rage Against The Machine]]. Director Peter Berg stated:
{{quote|Working with composers often is a really frustrating experience because you speak a different language and, oftentimes, they take two or three jobs, at the same time. They're difficult and pretentious and they're tormented artists. I'm not going to name names, but most of them are. One guy who isn't is [[Hans Zimmer]], who taught Steve Jablonsky. We had a couple of meetings and I came up with this idea. The day I met with him, I had had an [[Magnetic resonance imaging|MRI]] for my neck, and they make that really scary sound. I was like, 'I just had this MRI, and when I was in there, I was thinking about the aliens, and it was really scary.' And he was like, 'Oh, that's awesome!' He went and recorded MRIs and made music out of MRIs, and that's the theme of the aliens in our film. He is no drama, and just goes and gets it done. The score is big and awesome and scary and driving. At times, it's very simple and acoustic and touching and emotional. He's the best I've ever worked with.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://collider.com/brooklyn-decker-peter-berg-battleship-interview/153633/ |title=Brooklyn Decker and Director Peter Berg Talk BATTLESHIP, Naval Warfare and the Design of the Aliens at WonderCon |publisher=Collider |date=March 19, 2012 |accessdate=May 1, 2012}}</ref>}}
===Track listing=== All songs written and composed by Steve Jablonsky except where noted.
{{Track listing | headline = ''Battleship: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack'' | total_length = 77:28 | title1 = First Transmission | length1 = 3:19 | title2 = The Art of War | length2 = 4:33 | title3 = Full Attack | length3 = 3:55 | title4 = You're Going to the Navy | length4 = 1:04 | title5 = The Beacon Project | length5 = 5:09 | title6 = Objects Make Impact | length6 = 4:40 | title7 = First Contact, Part I | length7 = 1:53 | title8 = First Contact, Part II | length8 = 2:10 | title9 = It's Your Ship Now | length9 = 4:05 | title10 = Shredders | length10 = 4:07 | title11 = Regents Are on the Mainland | length11 = 2:44 | title12 = Trying to Communicate | length12 = 3:17 | title13 = Water Displacement | length13 = 2:20 | title14 = Buoy Grid Battle | length14 = 3:05 | title15 = USS John Paul Jones | length15 = 2:25 | title16 = We Have a Battleship | length16 = 2:51 | title17 = Somebody's Gonna Kiss the Donkey | length17 = 4:35 | title18 = Super Battle | length18 = 1:34 | note18 = composed by [[Tom Morello]] | title19 = Thug Fight | length19 = 3:31 | note19 = featuring [[Tom Morello]] | title20 = Battle on Land and Sea | length20 = 2:50 | title21 = Silver Star | length21 = 1:56 | title22 = The Aliens | length22 = 4:20 | title23 = Planet G | length23 = 4:01 | title24 = Hopper | length24 = 3:15 }}
;Additional music credits *[[Stone Temple Pilots]] – "[[Interstate Love Song]]" *[[Billy Squier]] – "[[Everybody Wants You]]" *Lucky Clark – "My Lai" *[[The Black Keys]] – "[[Gold on the Ceiling]]" *[[Citizen Cope]] – "One Lovely Day" *[[Dropkick Murphys]] – "Hang 'Em High" *[[Carl Perkins]] – "[[Blue Suede Shoes]]" *[[AC/DC]] – "[[Hard as a Rock]]" *[[ZZ Top]] – "I Gotsta Get Paid" *[[Royal Philharmonic Orchestra]] – "[[The Blue Danube|Waltz: On the Beautiful Blue Danube]]" *[[AC/DC]] – "[[Thunderstruck (song)|Thunderstruck]]" *[[Band of Horses]] – "[[The Funeral (Band of Horses song)|The Funeral]]" *[[Creedence Clearwater Revival]] – "[[Fortunate Son]]"
==Release== {{triple image|left|Taylor Kitsch, 2012.jpg|122|Rihanna 2012.jpg|131|Brooklyn Decker 2012.jpg|135|[[Taylor Kitsch]], [[Rihanna]] and [[Brooklyn Decker]] at the ''Battleship'' Australian [[Movie premiere|premiere]] in April 2012.}} The film was originally planned to be released in 2011, but was rescheduled to May 18, 2012, in the United States.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1440129/releaseinfo|title=Peter Berg's ''Battleship'' Is Now Sailing Memorial Day Weekend 2012|last=Weintraub|first=Steve|date=February 5, 2010|publisher=''Collider.com''|accessdate=July 10, 2010}}</ref> The film's world premiere took place in Tokyo on April 3, 2012. The event was attended by director [[Peter Berg]], actors [[Taylor Kitsch]], [[Brooklyn Decker]], [[Alexander Skarsgård]] and [[Rihanna]]. Later on they initiated a Press Tour visiting Madrid, London and Cartagena de Indias to promote the film.
===Box office=== The film earned $303,025,485, and only $65,422,625 in North America. With a budget of $209 million the film did not meet its expectations.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/movies/?page=intl&id=battleship.htm |title=Battleship (2012) - International Box Office Results |publisher= |date= |accessdate=September 6, 2012}}</ref>
The film opened outside North America on Wednesday, April 11, 2012, more than five weeks before its North America release, earning $7.4 million.<ref name="ddln-opening">{{cite news|url=http://www.deadline.com/2012/04/battleship-goes-to-war-overseas-1-almost-every-country-where-it-opened/|title=‘Battleship’ Builds $25M Foreign War Chest|first=Nikki|last=Finke|date=March 13, 2012|publisher=Deadline.com|accessdate=April 14, 2012}}</ref> Through Friday, April 13, the film had earned a 3-day total of $25 million.<ref name="THR-opening">{{cite news |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/three-stooges-cabin-in-the-woods-battleship-hunger-games-box-office-312179 |title=Box Office Report: 'Hunger Games' Edges Out 'Three Stooges,' 'Cabin in the Woods' |first=Pamela |last=McClintock |date=March 14, 2012 |work=The Hollywood Reporter |accessdate=April 14, 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/66vEsCggv?url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/three-stooges-cabin-in-the-woods-battleship-hunger-games-box-office-312179 |archivedate=April 14, 2012 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref> By the end of its opening weekend, it earned $55.2 million from 26 markets, ranking second behind the 3D re-release of ''[[Titanic (1997 film)#3D Theatrical Re-release|Titanic]]''.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/foreign-box-office-titanic-3d-china-hunger-games-battleship-312282|title=Foreign Box Office: 'Titanic 3D' Unsinkable No. 1 Overseas After Sensational China Debut|first=Frank|last=Segers|date=March 15, 2012|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=April 16, 2012}}</ref>
However, on its second weekend, it topped the box office outside North America, with $60 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3425&p=.htm|title=Around-the-World Roundup: 'Battleship' Sinks 'Titanic'|first=Ray|last=Subers|date=April 24, 2012|publisher=Box Office Mojo|accessdate=April 26, 2012}}</ref> In South Korea, it achieved the highest-grossing opening day for a non-sequel and the third-highest overall ($2.8 million).<ref name="THR-opening"/> In comparison to other [[Hasbro]] films, ''Battleship''{{'s}} opening in the UK (£3.76 million) was behind the first ''[[Transformers (film)|Transformers]]'' (£8.72 million), but did better than ''[[G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra]]'' (£1.71 million).<ref>{{cite web|last=Gant|first=Charles|title=Battleship cruises to top of UK box office charts|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/filmblog/2012/apr/17/battleship-uk-box-office?newsfeed=true|work=[[The Guardian]]|accessdate=April 24, 2012|date=April 17, 2012}}</ref>
In North America, ''Battleship'' grossed $8.8 million on its opening day (Friday, May 18, 2012), with $420,000 originating from midnight showings,<ref>{{cite web|last=Finke|first=Nikki|title=BOMBS AWAY! ‘Battleship’ Sinks To $25.3M Torpedoed By Still Strong ‘Avengers’; Lame ‘What To Expect’ Behind Limp ‘The Dictator’|url=http://www.deadline.com/2012/05/dictator-off-to-slow-domestic-start-international-box-office-begins-stronger/|publisher=deadline.com|accessdate=May 25, 2012}}</ref> and finished the weekend with $25.5 million. It settled in second place for its opening day and opening weekend behind ''[[Marvel's The Avengers]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Subers|first=Ray|title=Weekend Report: 'Battleship' Drowns Under Weight of 'Avengers'|url=http://boxofficemojo.com/news/?id=3445&p=.htm|publisher=Box Office Mojo|accessdate=May 25, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Box Office Report: 'Battleship' Torpedoed With $9.1 Million Friday|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/box-office-report-battleship-torpedoed-326833|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=May 19, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Young|first=John|title=Box office report: 'The Avengers' crushes 'Battleship' and 'The Dictator' with $55.1 mil|url=http://insidemovies.ew.com/2012/05/20/box-office-report-battleship-dictator/|publisher=Entertainment Weekly|accessdate=May 22, 2012}}</ref>
===Critical reception=== [[Metacritic]] has given the film an average score of 41 out of 100 based on 39 reviews meaning "mixed or average reviews".<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.metacritic.com/movie/battleship |title=Battleship |work=[[Metacritic]] |publisher=[[CBS Interactive]] |accessdate= January 14, 2014 | quote = Mixed or average reviews }}</ref> [[Rotten Tomatoes]] gives the film a score of 34% based on reviews from 217 critics, with a rating average of 4.6/10. The site's consensus reads: "It may offer energetic escapism for less demanding filmgoers, but ''Battleship'' is too loud, poorly written, and formulaic to justify its expense -- and a lot less fun than its source material."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/battleship/ |title=Battleship |work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] |publisher=[[Fandango (company)|Fandango]] |accessdate=September 29, 2018}}</ref>
Megan Lehmann of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' thought that the "impressive visual effects and director [[Peter Berg]]'s epic set pieces fight against an armada of cinematic clichés and some truly awful dialogue."<ref name=Lehmann>{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/film-review-battleship-310991 |title=Battleship: Film Review |last=Lehmann |first=Megan |date=April 11, 2012 |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|accessdate=April 18, 2012}}</ref> [[Empire (film magazine)|''Empire'' magazine]]'s Nick de Semlyen felt there was a lack of character development and memorable action shots, and sums up his review of the movie in one word: "Miss."<ref name=deSemlyen>{{cite news|url=http://www.empireonline.com/reviews/reviewcomplete.asp?FID=136712 |title=Empire's Battleship Movie Review |last=de Semlyen |first=Nick |publisher=[[Empire Magazine]] |accessdate=April 17, 2012}}</ref>
Many reviews criticised the "based on a board game" concept driving the film, although some, such as Jason Di Rosso from the [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]]'s [[Radio National]], claimed the ridiculousness of the setup is "either sheer joy or pure hell – depending on how seriously you take it", while de Semlyen "had to admire [the film's creators] jumping through hoops to engineer a sequence that replicates the board game."<ref name=deSemlyen/><ref name=Hardie/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/radionational/programs/movietime/battleship/3946780 |title=Battleship |last=Di Rosso |first=Jason |date=April 12, 2012 |work=MovieTime|publisher=[[Radio National]] ([[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]])|accessdate=April 18, 2012}}</ref> Several compared the film to [[Michael Bay]]'s ''[[Transformers (film)|Transformers]]'' film series in terms of quality and cinematic style, with Giles Hardie of ''[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]'' claiming that the movie "finds the same balance between action-packed imagination and not taking the premise seriously that made Michael Bay's original ''Transformers'' such a joyride."<ref name=Lehmann/><ref name=Hardie>{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/movies/realism-sinks-without-a-trace-but-guns-aliens-and-rihanna-triumph-20120411-1ws3c.html |title=Battleship movie review |last=Hardie |first=Giles |date=April 12, 2012 |work=The Sydney Morning Herald |accessdate=April 18, 2012}}</ref> Andrew Harrison of ''[[Q (magazine)|Q]]'' magazine called the film "crushingly stupid".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.qthemusic.com/2012/04/film_review_-_battleship_this.html|accessdate=April 30, 2012|date=April 11, 2012|title=Film review – Battleship: This brainless Rihanna vehicle deserves to be scuttled without delay|author=Andrew Harrison|publisher=[[Q (magazine)|Q]]|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120419205145/http://news.qthemusic.com/2012/04/film_review_-_battleship_this.html|archivedate=April 19, 2012|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Film critic Kenneth Turan, in a review written for the ''Los Angeles Times'', also expressed disappointment, criticizing the film's "humanoid aliens", stating that they are "as ungainly as the movie itself, clunking around in awkward, protective suits." He called the content "all very earnest", but added "it's not a whole lot of fun".<ref>{{cite web|last=Turan|first=Kenneth|title=Movie review: Aliens can have this 'Battleship'|url=http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/news/movies/la-et-battleship-20120518,0,6752668.story|publisher=L.A. Times|accessdate=May 20, 2012}}</ref> [[Peter Travers]] of ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' gave the film one out of four stars, and he comment "Battleship is all noise and crashing metal, sinking to the shallows of Michael Bay's Armageddon and then digging to the brain-extinction level of the Transformers trilogy."
Other critics were less harsh for ''Battleship'': Writing for ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'', Steven James Snyder was somewhat positive because he had low expectations of the film. He wrote, "The creative team behind this ocean-bound thriller decided to fill the narrative black hole with a few ingredients all but absent from today’s summer tent poles – namely mystery, nostalgia and a healthy dose of humility" and described it as "an unlikely mix of ''[[Independence Day (1996 film)|Independence Day]]'', ''[[Pearl Harbor (film)|Pearl Harbor]]'', ''[[Jurassic Park (film)|Jurassic Park]]'' and ''[[The Hunt for Red October (film)|The Hunt for Red October]]''".<ref>{{cite web|title=Battleship: More Fun Than a Board Game Blockbuster Has Any Right to Be|url=http://entertainment.time.com/2012/05/17/battleship-more-fun-than-a-board-game-blockbuster-has-any-right-to-be/#ixzz1vA22YnP7|work=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|accessdate=May 18, 2012|author=Steven James Snyder|date=May 17, 2012}}</ref> Giving it a B+ grade, Lisa Schwarzbaum of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' said, "For every line of howler dialogue that should have been sunk, there's a nice little scene in which humans have to make a difficult decision. For every stretch of generic sci-fi-via-CGI moviemaking, there's a welcome bit of wit."<ref>{{cite web|last=Schwarzbaum|first=Lisa|title=Battleship Review|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20587674,00.html|work=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=May 18, 2012|date=May 16, 2012}}</ref> ''[[The Washington Post]]'' gave the film a three-star rating out of four commenting it is "an invigorating blast of cinematic adrenaline".<ref>{{cite web|last=Righthand|first=Jess|title=‘Battleship’ and more new movies|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/going-out-gurus/post/battleship-and-more-new-movies/2012/05/17/gIQAnawqWU_blog.html|work=[[The Washington Post]]|accessdate=May 18, 2012|date=May 18, 2012}}</ref> [[Roger Ebert]] of the ''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]'' gave the film 2½ stars out of 4, praising the climax as "an honest-to-God third act, instead of just settling for nonstop fireballs and explosions, as Bay likes to do. I don't want to spoil it for you. Let's say the Greatest Generation still has the right stuff and leave it at that."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/battleship-2012 |title=Battleship |first=Roger |last=Ebert |publisher=RogerEbert.com |date=May 16, 2012 |accessdate=January 11, 2014 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6MYiDLMHN?url=http://www.rogerebert.com/reviews/battleship-2012 |archivedate=January 12, 2014 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy }}</ref>

Razzies|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/movies/news/a461205/twilight-breaking-dawn-part-2-kristen-stewart-rihanna-win-razzies.html|work=[[Digital Spy]]|accessdate=February 24, 2013|date=February 24, 2013}}</ref> | [[Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Picture|Worst Picture]] | |- | [[Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Director|Worst Director]] | [[Peter Berg]] |- | [[Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Supporting Actor|Worst Supporting Actor]] | [[Liam Neeson]] |- |rowspan=2|[[Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Supporting Actress|Worst Supporting Actress]] | [[Brooklyn Decker]] |- | [[Rihanna]] | {{won}} |- | [[Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Screenplay|Worst Screenplay]] | Jon Hoeber and Eric Hoeber | rowspan=2 {{nom}} |- | [[Golden Raspberry Award for Worst Screen Couple/Ensemble|Worst Screen Ensemble]] | |- | [[39th Saturn Awards|Saturn Awards]]<ref>{{cite web |last= |first= |date= |title=39th Annual Saturn Awards |url=http://www.saturnawards.org/39th_Annual_Saturn_Awards.pdf |publisher=[[Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy & Horror Films]] |accessdate=February 20, 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Ea1IEhIi?url=http://www.saturnawards.org/39th_Annual_Saturn_Awards.pdf |archivedate=February 20, 2013 |deadurl=yes |df=mdy }}</ref> | [[Saturn Award for Best Special Effects|Best Special Effects]] | Grady Cofer, [[Pablo Helman]], Jeanie King and [[Burt Dalton]] | {{nominated}} |- | [[2012 Teen Choice Awards|Teen Choice Awards]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/07/23/teen-choice-awards-winners-2012_n_1693766.html |title=Teen Choice Awards Winners 2012: 'Twilight,' 'The Vampire Diaries,' Justin Bieber Win Big |work=The Huffington Post |first= |last= |date=June 23, 2012 |accessdate=June 23, 2012 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6BtAIZvP7?url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/07/23/teen-choice-awards-winners-2012_n_1693766.html |archivedate=November 3, 2012 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }}</ref> | Choice Movie Breakout | [[Rihanna]] | {{won}} |- | rowspan="2"| [[Visual Effects Society]]<ref>{{cite web|last=Scott|first=Mike|title=Baton Rouge-shot 'Battleship' nominated for visual effects award; plus more movie briefs|url=http://www.nola.com/movies/index.ssf/2013/01/baton_rouge-shot_battleship_no.html|work=[[The Times-Picayune]]|accessdate=January 24, 2013|date=January 8, 2013}}</ref> | Outstanding Visual Effects in a Visual-Effects Driven Film | Grady Cofer, [[Pablo Helman]], Kevin Elam, Glen McIntosh | rowspan="2" {{nom}} |- | Outstanding FX and Simulation Animation in a Live Action Feature Motion Picture |Florent Andorra, Willi Geiger, Rick Hankins, Florian Witzel |- |}
===Home media=== ''Battleship'' was released on [[DVD]] and [[Blu-ray disc]] on August 20, 2012 in the United Kingdom,<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.amazon.co.uk/Battleship-Blu-ray-Rihanna/dp/B006GD74DQ/ |title=Battleship on Amazon |publisher=Amazon.co.uk |date= |accessdate=May 26, 2012}}</ref> and on August 28 in the United States and Canada.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.blu-ray.com/movies/Battleship-Blu-ray/45489/ |title=Battleship Blu-ray |publisher=Blu-ray.com |date= |accessdate=September 6, 2012}}</ref> Its revenue was $32.4 million. Battleship was released on 4K Blu-Ray on January 17, 2017.<ref>{{Citation|title=Battleship 4K Blu-ray|url=http://www.blu-ray.com/movies/Battleship-4K-Blu-ray/167180/|accessdate=2018-03-12}}</ref>
==Video game== A video game based on the film, titled ''[[Battleship (2012 video game)|Battleship: The Video Game]]'', was released on May 15, 2012 to coincide with the film's international release. The game was published by [[Activision]] and developed by [[Double Helix Games]] for [[PlayStation 3]], [[Wii]], and [[Xbox 360]], and developed by Magic Pockets for [[Nintendo 3DS]] and [[Nintendo DS]].
==Board game== Hasbro released several new editions of the classic board game, including an update to the regular fleet-vs.-fleet game and a "movie edition", featuring the alien vessels and a card-based play mode.
==See also== * ''[[American Warships]]'', the [[mockbuster]] film released at the same time and featuring one of USS ''Missouri''{{'}}s [[sister ship]]s, {{USS|Iowa|BB-61|6}}. * ''[[Under Siege]]'', a 1992 film also set on board USS ''Missouri'' starring [[Steven Seagal]].

{{Infobox video game | image = COP The Recruit.jpg | caption = European box art | developer = VD-Dev | publisher = [[Ubisoft]] | designer = | composer = [[Jason Graves]]
Dan Schneider
Davide Pensato (dpstudios) | engine = | released = {{vgrelease|NA|November 3, 2009|PAL|November 13, 2009}} | genre = [[Action-adventure game|Action-adventure]] | modes = [[Single-player]] | platforms = [[Nintendo DS]] }} '''''C.O.P. The Recruit''''' is a video game published by [[Ubisoft]] for the [[Nintendo DS]]. The game was announced at [[E3 2009]] at the [[Nintendo]] conference.{{cite web | last=Ahearn | first=Nate | date=June 2, 2009 | url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2009/06/02/e3-2009-cop-the-recruit-announced | title=E3 2009: C.O.P.: The Recruit Announced | publisher=[[IGN]] | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} The game was originally registered under numerous names, one of which being ''Driver: The Recruit''.{{cite web | last=Feeney | first=Richard | date=June 2, 2009 | url=http://www.onelastcontinue.com/7966/e3-2009-cop-the-recruit-drivers-little-brother | title=E3 2009: C.O.P. The Recruit – Driver’s little brother? | publisher=One Last Continue | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091112021500/http://www.onelastcontinue.com/7966/e3-2009-cop-the-recruit-drivers-little-brother | archivedate=November 12, 2009 | deadurl=yes | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} ==Plot== The game follows Dan Miles, a former street racer who becomes a new recruit in the Criminal Overturn Program (C.O.P.). Under the terms of the C.O.P., Dan becomes a detective working to protect the citizens of [[New York City]] against large-scale threats. Working with his mentor, Detective Brad Winter, Dan is investigating a series of terrorist attacks in the city when Brad is falsely arrested, putting the investigation on hold. While trying to uncover the truth behind Brad's arrest, Dan goes undercover and returns to his life on the streets. Little by little he gets wrapped up in a deadly, widespread conspiracy and must work to prevent a potentially catastrophic attack on the city.{{cite web | url=http://www.ign.com/games/cop-the-recruit/nds-14344025 | title=C.O.P.: The Recruit - Nintendo DS | publisher=IGN | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} ==Gameplay== The game is a third person shooter and a driving game, in a New York City with the same map layout and environment as ''[[Driver: Parallel Lines]]'' (confirming its relation with the [[Driver (series)|Driver series]]), however due to memory constraints lacking the island of [[Bronx]]. Also it has most of the sound effects from Driver: Parallel Lines recycled in game along with most of the cars. The game has around 51 missions with over 20 hours of gameplay. It's also possible, using the DS system's microphone (and the in-game PDA), to call the S.W.A.T. team, create barricades, road blocks, call an ambulance and access the city's camera system. {{clear}} ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | MC = 55/100{{cite web | url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/ds/cop-the-recruit | title=C.O.P.: The Recruit for DS Reviews | publisher=[[Metacritic]] | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} | EuroG = 4/10{{cite web | last=Walker | first=John | date=November 24, 2009 | url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/cop-the-recruit-ds-review | title=COP: The Recruit | publisher=[[Eurogamer]] | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} | GI = 4.25/10{{cite journal | last=Kollar | first=Phil | url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/cop_the_recruit/b/nintendo_ds/archive/2009/11/19/review.aspx | title=C.O.P. The Recruit: Poor Theft Auto | magazine=[[Game Informer]] | issue=201 | date=January 2010 | page=94 | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} | GamePro = {{Rating|3.5|5}}{{cite web | last=Koehn | first=Aaron | date=November 4, 2009 | url=http://www.gamepro.com/article/reviews/212829/c-o-p-the-recruit | title=C.O.P. The Recruit | publisher=''[[GamePro]]'' | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091106020256/http://www.gamepro.com/article/reviews/212829/c-o-p-the-recruit | archivedate=November 6, 2009 | deadurl=yes | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} | GameRev = D{{cite web | last=Farnham | first=Donovan | date=November 20, 2009 | url=http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/cop-the-recruit | title=C.O.P. The Recruit Review | publisher=[[Game Revolution]] | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} | GameZone = 7.5/10{{cite web | last=Bedigian | first=Louis | date=November 16, 2009 | url=http://www.gamezone.com/reviews/c_o_p_the_recruit_nds_review | title=C.O.P. The Recruit - NDS - Review | publisher=GameZone | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091124234241/http://nds.gamezone.com/gzreviews/r38421.htm | archivedate=November 24, 2009 | deadurl=no | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} | IGN = 5/10{{cite web | last=Bishop | first=Sam | date=December 2, 2009 | url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2009/12/03/cop-the-recruit-review | title=C.O.P.: The Recruit Review | publisher=IGN | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} | NLife = {{Rating|7|10}}{{cite web | last=Newton | first=James | date=November 23, 2009 | url=http://www.nintendolife.com/reviews/2009/11/cop_the_recruit_ds | title=Review: C.O.P. The Recruit | publisher=[[Nintendo Life]] | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} | NP = 4/10{{cite journal | title=C.O.P.: The Recruit | magazine=[[Nintendo Power]] | volume=249 | date=December 25, 2009 | page=89}} | NWR = 6/10{{cite web | last=Jones | first=James | date=November 24, 2009 | url=http://www.nintendoworldreport.com/review/20402/cop-the-recruit-nintendo-ds | title=C.O.P. The Recruit | publisher=Nintendo World Report | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} | VG = 5/10{{cite web | last=Yin-Poole | first=Wesley | date=November 30, 2009 | url=http://www.videogamer.com/ds/cop_the_recruit/review.html | title=COP The Recruit Review | publisher=VideoGamer.com | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} }} ''C.O.P. The Recruit'' received "mixed" reviews according to video game [[review aggregator]] [[Metacritic]]. The game won two Best of E3 2009 Awards: Best Action Game{{cite web | author=IGN Nintendo Team | date=June 10, 2009 | url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2009/06/10/nintendo-ds-best-of-e3-2009 | title=Nintendo DS Best of E3 2009 | publisher=IGN | accessdate=April 22, 2016}} and Best Graphics Technology. {{clear}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://coptherecruit.us.ubi.com/ Official website] *{{moby game|id=/nintendo-ds/cop-the-recruit}} {{Driver series}} [[Category:Video games set in New York City]] [[Category:Ubisoft games]] [[Category:Nintendo DS-only games]] [[Category:Nintendo DS games]] [[Category:2009 video games]] [[Category:Action-adventure games]] [[Category:Open world video games]] [[Category:Video games scored by Jason Graves]] [[Category:Video games developed in France]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2017}} {{Use British English|date=April 2017}} The ''Brotherhood of Centurions'' is a [[Club (organization)|club]] for which [[Racewalking|racewalkers]] are eligible who have completed a distance of 100 [[mile|international miles]] (160.9 km) in [[United Kingdom|Britain]] within 24 hours. Its name derives from a popular title from those competitors achieving the feat in the 19th century British long-distance walking sport, called [[Pedestrianism]].
Pedestrianism was to be a popular spectator sport during the 18th and 19th centuries, as [[equestrianism]] still is, and [[bicycle racing]] became afterwards. Among the most famous professional pedestrians of that time was [[Robert Barclay Allardice]], who completed one mile (1.6 km) in each of 1000 sequential hours.
In 1911, the Centurion title was set up as an award for amateur racewalkers. The first number was awarded to James Edwin Fowler-Dixon for a performance in [[London]] in 1877, and who was also elected the first president. Each successful Centurion earns the next number in sequence. That number belonging to the recipient in perpetuity. Since 1902, 100 mile (160.9 km) racewalks have been performed on a regular basis, with 94 held as of 2017. Centurion qualifying races are held annually in the [[United Kingdom]], including the [[Isle of Man]]. In addition to the British Centurions, Centurion clubs with their own qualifying races exist in [[the Netherlands]], the [[United States]], [[Australia]], [[New Zealand]], and [[South Africa]]. The club in [[Malaysia]] is currently inactive. Each club worldwide holds the same high standard. Members must walk a distance of 100 miles (160.9 km) within 24 hours.
The most successful competitor in Centurion is [[Sandra Brown (ultradistance athlete)|Sandra Brown]] with 25 wins of the category for ladies. Some Centurions known primarily for their achievements in other distances are [[Brian_Adams_(race_walker)|Brian Adams]], [[Bill_Brown_(racewalker)|William Brown]], [[John_Kelly_(racewalker)|John Kelly]], [[Daniel_King_(racewalker)|Daniel]] and [[Dominic_King_(racewalker)|Dominic King]], [[Yiannis Kouros]], [[Shaul Ladany]], [[Frank O'Reilly]], [[Ian_Richards_(racewalker)|Ian Richards]], [[Don_Thompson_(racewalker)|Don Thompson]], and [[Rex Whitlock]].
A Newsletter is published by Australian Centurion Tim Erickson. Centurion News, race calendar, race results. *[http://www.centurions.org.au/centnewsletters.shtml Newsletter]
==References== *[http://www.centurions1911.org.uk/history-of-the-centurions.html Centurions History] *[http://www.centurions.org.au/documents/cent-history.pdf Australian Centurion History] *[http://www.unitedstatescenturionwalkers.com/?page_id=123 The complete History of United States Centurion Races]
==Centurion Members of each Club== *[http://www.centurions.org.au/documents/List%20of%20British%20Centurions.pdf Members list of British Centurions] *[http://www.centurions.org.au/documents/List%20of%20Continental%20Centurions.pdf Members list of Continental Centurions] *[http://www.centurions.org.au/documents/List%20of%20USA%20Centurions.pdf Members list of United States Centurions] *[http://www.centurions.org.au/documents/List%20of%20Australian%20Centurions.pdf Members list of Australian Centurions] *[http://www.centurions.org.au/documents/List%20of%20NZ%20Centurions.pdf Members list of New Zealand Centurions] *[http://www.centurions.org.au/documents/List%20South%20Africa.pdf Members list of African Centurions] *[http://www.centurions.org.au/documents/List%20of%20Malaysian%20Centurions.pdf Members list of Malaysian Centurions]
These Centurion Members are affiliated with Multiple Clubs *[http://www.walk100miles24hours.com/centurions-with-multiple-world-bagdes Multiple Centurion List]
==World Centurion Clubs== *[http://www.centurions1911.org.uk British Centurions Website] *[http://www.centurionverenigingnederland.nl Continental Centurions Website] ''Centurion Vereniging Nederland'' *[http://www.unitedstatescenturionwalkers.com/ United States Centurion Website] *[http://www.centurions.org.au/ Australian Centurions Website] *[https://www.math.auckland.ac.nz/~sharp/nzcenturions/index.html New Zealand Centurions Website] *[http://www.africancenturion.com/ African Centurion Website]

{{Infobox video game |title = Deus |image = MS-DOS Deus cover art.jpg |caption = North American cover art |developer = [[Silmarils (company)|Silmarils]] |publisher = {{vgrelease|NA|ReadySoft|EU|Silmarils}} |producer = Louis-Marie Rocques |programmer = André Rocques
Louis Elmer
Marc Bourlon |artist = Arnaud Beaume
Eric Galand
Guillaume Maginot |composer = Fabrice Hautecloque |platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]]
[[MS-DOS]] |released = 31 December {{vgy|1996}} |genre = [[Survival game|Survival]], [[Simulation video game|simulation]] |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''''Deus''''' is a [[1996 in video gaming|1996]] survival [[simulation game]] developed by [[Silmarils (company)|Silmarils]] and published by [[ReadySoft]]. It is the sequel to ''[[Robinson's Requiem]]''. ==Story== {{expand section|date=March 2016}} The player again assumes the role of ''Robinson's Requiem'' protagonist Officer Trepliev, who has become a bounty hunter for the Alien World Exploration department{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/19991115221047/http://www.pcgamer.com/reviews/342.html | url=http://www.pcgamer.com/reviews/342.html | title=''Deus'' | last=Wolf | first=Scott | date=April 1997 | work=[[PC Gamer US]] | archivedate=November 15, 1999 | accessdate=October 14, 2010 | deadurl=yes | df= }} and has to save a scientific research station from a group of terrorists called the New Crusaders.{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20000816005148/http://www.gamespot.com/action/deus/review_cgw.html | url=http://www.gamespot.com/action/deus/review_cgw.html | title=Tedious Survival | last=Nguyen | first=Thierry | date=June 1, 1997 | work=[[Computer Gaming World]] | archivedate=August 16, 2000 | accessdate=October 14, 2010 | deadurl=yes | df= }} ==Gameplay== Like ''Robinson's Requiem'', the game features complex health monitoring and surgery systems; however, the game now contains an optional "action mode", which removes these systems. == Release == Prior to its release on DOS and Windows, the game was originally in development for the [[Atari Jaguar CD]] under the working title ''Deus Ex Machina'' and was planned to be published around the fourth quarter of 1995, however, this early version was never released.{{cite magazine|last=|first=|url=http://download.abandonware.org/magazines/CD%20Consoles/cdconsoles_numero05/Page%20077.jpg|title=Dossier - Ils Arrivent Sur Jaguar - Deus/Jaguar CD|magazine=CD Consoles|issue=5|publisher=Pressimage|date=March 1995|page=77|lang=fr}}{{cite web|url=http://www.atarihq.com/jeo/archive.htm|title=Atari Explorer Online - Volume 4, Issue 4|website=atarihq.com|date=March 28, 1995|accessdate=2018-11-09}}{{cite magazine|last=|first=|url=http://download.abandonware.org/magazines/ST%20Magazine/stmagazine_numero093/st%20magazine%20-%20N93%20-%20avril%201995%20-%20page058%20et%20059.jpg|title=Cahier loisirs / Avant première - Exclusif: Silmarils Et Le Jaguar|magazine=[[:fr:ST Magazine|ST Magazine]]|issue=93|publisher=Pressimage|date=April 1995|page=59|lang=fr}}{{cite magazine|last=|first=|url=https://archive.org/stream/MANIAC.N020.1995.06/MANIAC.N020.1995.06-DURiAN_Searchable#page/n39/mode/1up|title=Feature - XT Generation Report - Atari Jaguar|magazine=[[:de:M! Games|MAN!AC]]|issue=20|publisher=Cybermedia Verlagsgesellschaft mbH|date=June 1995|page=40|lang=de}}{{cite magazine|last=Nepožitek|first=Marek|url=http://www.oldgames.sk/en/mag/level-6/page/44/|title=Konzole - Jaguar+CD - CD a virtuální realita již tento rok?|magazine=[[LeveL]]|issue=6|publisher=Naked Dog, s.r.o.|date=July 1995|page=44|lang=cs}}{{cite web|url=http://www.atarihq.com/jeo/archive.htm|title=Atari Explorer Online - Volume 4, Issue 5|website=atarihq.com|date=July 20, 1995|accessdate=2018-09-26}} ==Reception== ''Deus''{{'}} critical reception was mixed. ''[[Computer Gaming World]]'' found the realism of the simulation mode to be overwhelming, and described the game's action mode as "dull". ''[[PC Gamer US]]''{{'}}s Scott Wolf said that the game's "[i]rritations [...] outweigh any enjoyment you might find". ''[[PC Gamer UK]]'' offered a dissenting opinion; despite calling the initial learning curve "alpine", the reviewer wrote, "After a while [...] Deus suddenly starts being fun. You begin to get the hang of the interface, and start to get into the plot".{{cite web | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20020316021556/http://www.pcgamer.co.uk/games/gamefile_review_page.asp?item_id=321 | url=http://www.pcgamer.co.uk/games/gamefile_review_page.asp?item_id=321 | title=''Deus'' | work=[[PC Gamer UK]] | archivedate=March 16, 2002 | accessdate=October 14, 2010 | deadurl=yes | df= }} == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/pc/197107-deus ''Deus''] at [[GameFAQs]] * [https://www.giantbomb.com/deus/3030-3226/ ''Deus''] at [[Giant Bomb]] * [https://www.mobygames.com/game/deus ''Deus''] at [[MobyGames]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Deus (video game)}} [[Category:1996 video games]] [[Category:Cancelled Atari Jaguar games]] [[Category:DOS games]] [[Category:Survival video games]] [[Category:Video games developed in France]] [[Category:Windows games]] {{simulation-videogame-stub}}

{{Infobox amusement park | name = Dyrehavsbakken | image = [[File:Bakken entry.jpg|250px]] | caption = Entrance to Bakken | resort = | location = Klampenborg, [[Denmark]] | location2 = | location3 = | coordinates = {{Coord|55.775813|N|12.574818|E|type:landmark_region:DK|display=it}} | theme = | homepage = [http://www.bakken.dk/ Bakken.dk] | owner = | general_manager = Niels-Erik Winther | operator = | opening_date = {{Start date and years ago|df=yes|1583}} | closing_date = <!-- {{End date|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | previous_names = | season = | visitors = | area = 75,000 m<sup>2</sup> | rides = 33 | coasters = 6 | water_rides = 1 | slogan = ''Der er noget om snakken, der er dejligt på Bakken'' (There is something to it, Bakken is lovely) | status = <!-- planned, under construction, operating, closed --> | footnotes = }} '''Dyrehavsbakken''' ("The Animal Park's Hill"), commonly referred to as '''Bakken''' ("The Hill"), is an [[amusement park]] near [[Klampenborg]] ([[Gentofte|Gentofte municipality]]), but which belongs under [[Lyngby-Taarbæk Kommune]], [[Denmark]], about 10 km north of central [[Copenhagen]]. It opened in 1583<ref name=bakken>{{cite web | title= The history of Bakken | url= http://www.bakken.dk/english/bakken-the-worlds-oldest-amusement-park| work= | publisher= | date=2015-03-08 | accessdate=2015-03-08}}</ref> and is the world's oldest operating amusement park.<ref>{{cite web | title= Oldest amusement park in operation| url= http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/oldest-amusement-park-in-operation/ | work= | publisher= | date= | accessdate=2015-09-01}}</ref>
With 2.5-2.7 million visitors per year, it is the second most popular attraction in Denmark, after the more widely known [[Tivoli Gardens]] amusement park.<ref>{{cite web | title= Top 25 Attractions in Denmark| url= http://www.visitdenmark.com/usa/en-us/menu/turist/turistinformation/attraktioner/top25attraktioner.htm| work= | publisher= | date= 2009-02-25| accessdate=2009-04-06}}</ref>
==History== [[File:Dyrehavsbakken, c. 1825.jpg|thumb|200px|Dyrehavsbakken in c. 1825]] [[File:Dyrehavsbakken 1849.jpg|thumb|200px|Dyrehavsbakken in 1840]] [[Image:Dyrehavsbakken i 1800-tallet.png|right|thumb|200px|Dyrehavsbakken in the 19th century]] The origins of Dyrehavsbakken can be traced back to 1583 when Kirsten Piil discovered a natural spring in what is now known as [[Jægersborg Dyrehave]] or Dyrehaven, a large forest park north of [[Copenhagen]].<ref name=bakken /> Residents of Copenhagen were attracted to the spring water due to the poor water quality in central Copenhagen during this period. Many believed the natural spring to have curative properties, and therefore Piil's discovery drew large crowds, especially in the springtime.<ref name=bakken /> These large crowds attracted entertainers and hawkers, whose presence are the origins of the [[amusement parks|amusement park]] today.
For a period the area that the spring was located on, was not open to the public due to it being on royal hunting grounds.<ref name=bakken /> In 1669, [[Frederick III of Denmark|King Frederick III]] decided to set up an animal park in the area and his son, [[Christian V]], extended the size of the park by 3-4 times after he became king in 1670. The area was named [[Jægersborg Dyrehave]], its present name, in 1671. The park was off-limits to the general public under Christian V and this did not change until 1756, under [[Frederick V of Denmark|Frederick V]].
Open to the general public once again, Dyrehavsbakken began to flourish. The entertainers, hawkers, and innkeepers returned to the area, and Bakken's growing reputation throughout Europe attracted other entertainers and artists, including [[Pierrot|Pjerrot]], the clown who still is a fixture at the park today.<ref name=bakken /> Bakken continued to grow even throughout the [[Napoleonic Wars]]. Its popularity was later aided by easier accessibility due to the development of steamships (1820) and railroads (1864), as well as good publicity from poets and authors.<ref name=bakken />
As the popularity of Bakken grew, its conditions worsened. As a result, some of the business owners, or "tent owners" as they are still called today, created the Dyrehavsbakken Tent Owners’ Association of 1885.<ref name=bakken /> The association improved garbage collection, restroom facilities, water supply, publicity, and helped bring electricity to the park. The association is still around today, and all businesses operating in the park are required to join.
The entertainment options also improved over time. [[Cabarets]] such as Sansouci, which opened in 1866, and Bakkens Hvile, which opened in 1877, became increasingly popular.<ref name=bakken /> The 20th century brought other popular ventures, such as the Circus Revue and automated moving rides.<ref name=bakken /> Over time, more modern rides and entertainment options have been introduced.
==Rides== [[Image:Rutschebanen roller coaster.jpg|right|thumb|216px|Rutschebanen roller coaster]] Bakken may have started as a place to get clean spring water, but today it is a thriving amusement park filled with modern rides and amenities. Bakken is home to six [[roller coasters]], the most famous of which is ''Rutschebanen'' (Danish for "The Roller Coaster"), a [[wooden roller coaster]] open since 1932. ''Rutschebanen'' has been deemed an [[American Coaster Enthusiasts]] Coaster Classic.<ref>{{cite web | title= ACE Coaster Classic Awards| url= http://www.aceonline.org/CoasterAwards/?type=1| work= | publisher= | date= | accessdate=2009-04-06}}</ref> The park is also home to dozens of other [[amusement rides|amusements]] and smaller rides suited for all ages.
===Roller coasters=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Ride Name !! Type !! Year Opened !! Manufacturer !! Additional Information |- | Mariehønen (Ladybird) || steel sit down || 1981 || [[Zierer]] || Reaches a speed of 16 mph (26 km) on a 198 ft long track (60m) and a height of 11 ft (3m). Small Tivoli model, train 2x5. |- | Mine Train Ulven (The Wolf) || steel sit down || 1997 || [[Intamin]] || Reaches a speed of 40 mph (65 km). Mine train model. |- | Racing || steel sit down || 1980 || Zierer || This single-seat car-style coaster was built in 1971. |- | Rutschebanen || wooden sit down || 1932 || Lebela || Reaches a speed of 47 mph (75 km) on a 3238 ft long track (987m) and a height of 72 ft (22m). |- | Tornado || steel sit down spinning coaster || 2009 || Intamin || The cars spins around the 984 ft long track (300m). |- | De Vilde Mus (The Wild Mice) || steel sit down || 2012 || [[Mack Rides]] || Compact wild mouse coaster, car 2+2. |- |}
===Other rides=== Each of the rides requires a certain number of coupons. *'''Afro Cups''' - spinning cups (4 coupons). *'''Bumper Cars''' - bumper cars (5 coupons) *'''Crazy Theater''' - indoor laser shoot-out (6 coupons). *'''Dillen''' - jetski ride (4 coupons). *'''Enterprise''' - enterprise spinner (5 coupons). *'''Extreme''' - giant swing (6 coupons). *'''5D Cimema''' - shows 4 different movies, each about 10 – 12 minutes long (8 coupons). *'''Ghost Train''' - indoor ghost train (5 coupons). *'''Hullabaloo''' - funny house (4 coupons). *'''Jungle Boats''' - boats and water shooting (4 coupons). *'''Polyp''' - polyp spinner (5 coupons). *'''Rodeobanen''' - on track go carts. *'''Safari''' - dark ride laser shoot out (5 coupons). *'''Samba Tower''' - air carousel (4 coupons). *'''Spinning Car''' - hovercraft ride (4 coupons). *'''SRV''' - simulator ride (4 coupons). *'''Swan Station''' - aerial swan ride. *'''Tower Thrill''' - a 30m tall drop tower (6 coupons). *'''Water Cannon''' - water shoot out on boats (5 coupons). *'''Viking Ship Dragon''' - swinging Viking ship (5 coupons). *'''Water Slide''' - a log flume ride. Travels a 390 m long course and has two drops on the way (5 coupons).
===Kiddie rides=== *'''Bin Express''' - roundabout (4 coupons). *'''Börne Ferris Wheel''' - mini [[Ferris wheel]] (4 coupons). *'''Carousel''' - children's carousel (3 coupons). *'''Hip Hop''' - mini drop tower (4 coupons). *'''Jeep''' - on track jeep ride (3 coupons). *'''Klatrejungle''' - challenge course. *'''Little Trains''' mini train ride (4 coupons). *'''Mini Dumpo''' - circular ride (3 coupons). *'''Santa's Obstacle Course''' - play area.
===Shows=== *'''Bakkens Hvile''' - cabaret show. *'''Circus Revue''' - revue show from 19 May to 27 August. *'''Pjerrot the Clown''' - the park's mascot entertains the kids. *'''Bakken Animals''' - animal show.
==Other attractions== Bakken contains many other entertainment options in addition to rides. This includes 7 different Gaming Halls that have [[carnival]]-style games, [[slot machines]], and dancing. The park's mascot, Pjerrot the clown, performs everyday for young children. The park is also home to Bakkens Hvile music hall, where [[cabarets]] are common, as well as the Circus Revue, a live [[circus]]-style performance.<ref name=bakken2>{{cite web | title= Welcome to Dyrehavsbakken| url= http://www.bakken.dk/english.html| work= | publisher= | date= | accessdate=2009-04-06}}</ref> There are also live music performances in lounges and bars across the park on a regular basis.
The park is home to dozens of restaurants of all tastes and price ranges. The style of restaurants range from standard amusement park [[street food]] vendors, to buffets, to fancier wine-and-dine restaurants. The type of food represented ranges from standard amusement park fare, such as hamburgers and [[cotton candy]], to tradition Danish cuisine, such as [[Pølser]] (Danish hot dogs), [[Æbleskiver]] (Danish popovers), and [[Smørrebrød]] (open-faced sandwiches), to many other types of international cuisine. Bakken also contains numerous bars and lounges, where popular Danish [[beer]] such as [[Carlsberg Group|Carlsberg]] and [[Tuborg]] are served.
==Operation== Bakken is open daily from the end of March through the end of August. Entrance into the park area is free, but rides and attractions require money. Price depends on the ride or attraction. Discounted coupons, wristbands, and season passes can also be purchased.<ref>{{cite web | title= Bakken: Prices| url= http://www.bakken.dk/english/prices.html| work= | publisher= | date= | accessdate=2009-04-06}}</ref>
==Gallery== {{Cleanup-gallery|date=February 2013}} <gallery perrow="4"> Image:Dyrehavsbakken.jpg|Near the entrance of Rutschebanen Image:Bakken water ride.jpg|Water ride Image:Dyrehavsbakken 2.jpg|Various restaurants and attractions Image:Bakken exit sign.jpg|Exit sign </gallery>
==See also== * [[Tourism in Denmark]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.bakken.dk/ Bakken website] {{da icon}} * [https://www.bakken.dk/english Bakken website] {{en icon}} * [http://www.denmark.net/denmark-guide/attractions-denmark/dyrehavsbakken.html Review of Bakken] * [http://www.rcdb.com/pd379.htm Roller Coaster DataBase: Bakken]
